member.name: T:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp
member.summary: This is the MusicPlayerApp class.

member.name: F:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.Player
member.summary: This declares the Windows Media Player Control

member.name: F:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.paths
member.summary: Create Global variables of String Type Array to save the titles of the Tracks and their paths

member.name: F:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.files
member.summary: Create Global variables of String Type Array to save the titles of the Tracks and their paths

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnSelectSongs_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button handler allows the user to select a group of songs via the FileDialog box. Multiselect is set on Array files is set to the names of the .mp3 files. Array paths is set to the URLs of the .mp3 files. The titles are displayed in the listbox.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.listBoxSongs_SelectedIndexChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This handler runs when a song title in the listbox is selected. It plays only that song and then play ends.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnPlayNextSong_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button handler plays the next song in the list of songs as long as the end of the list has not been reached. If the last song is playing when the button is pressed, then go back to the first song in the list.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.pictureBox1_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This handler closes the app when you click the X in the upper right corner of the window.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnPlayAll_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button handler handles the Play All button. First it creates a new, empty playlist, Then it adds each URL in array paths to the playlist. Finally, it sets the playlist to the current playlist for playback.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.HighlightCurrentSong(System.Windows.Forms.ListBox)
member.summary: This handler highlights the current song It sets axWindowsMediaPlayerMusic controls to stop playing the playlist and sets the index to the first song.
member.param: This is the list of songs in the listbox

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnStop_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This button handler handles the Stop button It sets axWindowsMediaPlayerMusic controls to stop playing the playlist and sets the index to the first song.
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.listBoxPlaylist_SelectedIndexChanged(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for ListBoxSongs playlist selection change If the index is valid, then set the axWindowsMediaPlayerMusic.URL to the paths listBoxSongs selected index and set the axWindowsMediaPlayerMusic controls to play the playlist
member.param: This is the object that raised the event

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnClearListBox_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for Clear List Box button to clear all items from the list box. This button can be used to reset the playlist to allow the user to select a new set of songs.

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.btnPlayPrevSong_Click(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Event handler for Play Previous Song button to play the previous song in the list. If the first song is currently playing, then go to the last song in the list.

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:MusicPlayerApp.MusicPlayerApp.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.
